hero.headline: OpenAI Patches Critical Codex CLI Vulnerability as GPT-5.1-Codex-Max Rolls Out
hero.summary: A busy week for OpenAI's Codex: they patched CVE-2025-61260, a critical command injection vulnerability (CVSS 9.8) that allowed attackers to execute arbitrary commands via malicious .env files. Meanwhile, GPT-5.1-Codex-Max entered public preview in GitHub Copilot—the first model natively trained for multi-context 'compaction' across millions of tokens.
hero.whyItMatters: The security patch reveals how agentic AI tools create new attack surfaces—Codex CLI's trust of .env files allowed supply chain attacks without user interaction. The GPT-5.1-Codex-Max release represents a paradigm shift: models designed from the ground up for long-running, multi-file tasks rather than single-prompt interactions. This is where AI coding is heading.

topStories.title: Google's Titans Architecture: Giving AI Long-Term Memory
topStories.summary: Google Research unveiled Titans, a new neural architecture designed to give AI models persistent long-term memory. The MIRA approach helps AI maintain context across much longer interactions, addressing one of the fundamental limitations of transformer-based models.

topStories.title: ICLR 2026 Study Documents 50+ AI Hallucinations in Academic Submissions
topStories.summary: GPTZero published a sobering analysis of ICLR 2026 submissions, documenting over 50 new types of AI hallucinations in academic papers. The study highlights accuracy issues even in peer-reviewed AI research, raising questions about AI-assisted academic writing.

topStories.title: Open Notebook: Open-Source Alternative to Google NotebookLM
topStories.summary: An open-source implementation of Google's NotebookLM has emerged, offering more flexibility and features. The TypeScript project enables developers to build their own AI-powered notebook experiences with customizable models and features.

topStories.title: byLLM: Add AI to Software Without Prompt Engineering
topStories.summary: A new framework enables seamless LLM integration with a single line of code, automatically generating context-aware prompts. In evaluations, developers completed tasks 3x faster with 45% fewer lines of code compared to manual prompt engineering with DSPy.

trendingRepos.name: microsoft/VibeVoice
trendingRepos.description: Microsoft's open-source frontier voice AI for building conversational applications with natural speech synthesis and real-time voice interactions. Trending with 1,825 stars today.

trendingRepos.name: lfnovo/open-notebook
trendingRepos.description: Open-source NotebookLM alternative with more flexibility. Build AI-powered notebooks with custom models and features. 543 stars today.

trendingRepos.name: cloudflare/vibesdk
trendingRepos.description: An open-source vibe coding platform that helps you build your own vibe-coding platform, built entirely on Cloudflare stack. 149 stars today.

trendingRepos.name: slidevjs/slidev
trendingRepos.description: Presentation slides for developers—write slides in Markdown with Vue components, code highlighting, and live coding. 212 stars today.

trendingSkills.name: choose-skill
trendingSkills.description: Meta-agent that analyzes tasks and recommends optimal skill combinations with Feynman-style explanations. Perfect for managing complex multi-skill workflows.

trendingSkills.name: skill-creator
trendingSkills.description: Framework for developing new Claude Code skills that extend capabilities through specialized knowledge and workflows. Build your own prompt patterns.

trendingSkills.name: systematic-debugging
trendingSkills.description: Four-phase debugging framework ensuring thorough root cause investigation before implementing solutions. Prevents premature fix attempts.

trendingSkills.name: docs-seeker
trendingSkills.description: Searches technical documentation using llms.txt standards and GitHub repository analysis via Repomix for comprehensive reference gathering.

newMcpServers.name: schemacrawler-ai
newMcpServers.description: Natural language interaction with your database schema. Ask questions like 'Explain the interest calculation stored procedure' and get schema-aware SQL help. Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite.

newMcpServers.name: arxiv-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Bridge between AI assistants and arXiv's research repository. Search papers with advanced filtering, download as markdown, and analyze content—perfect for literature reviews.

newMcpServers.name: gmail-mcp
newMcpServers.description: Gmail operations via IMAP/SMTP with app password auth. List messages, search emails, and send messages through AI workflows—automate your inbox management.

newMcpServers.name: kubectl-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: AI assistants interact with Kubernetes clusters via kubectl operations. Manage deployments, debug pods, and explore cluster state through natural language.

notableHooks.name: Auto-Commit with Prompt Messages
notableHooks.description: Parses session transcript via JSONL to extract the last user prompt and use it as a commit message. Creates automatic checkpoint commits enabling easy rollback without manual commit management.

notableHooks.name: Multi-Session Branch Isolation
notableHooks.description: Runs parallel Claude sessions where each automatically commits to separate branches (refs/heads/claude/{session-id}). Uses shadow Git indexes per session to prevent conflicts between simultaneous work.

notableHooks.name: Desktop Notification on Completion
notableHooks.description: Sends macOS notification with sound when Claude finishes a session. Uses osascript to display 'Claude has finished!' alert—essential for long-running autonomous tasks.

tuiTools.name: fresh
tuiTools.description: Text editor for your terminal: easy, powerful and fast. A modern Rust-based alternative offering vim-like efficiency without the steep learning curve. Trending on GitHub today.

tuiTools.name: k9s
tuiTools.description: Kubernetes CLI to manage clusters in style. Navigate pods, logs, deployments with vim keybindings and real-time updates—the essential K8s TUI.

tuiTools.name: gitui
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal UI for git written in Rust. Offers the staging, diffing, and committing power of lazygit with even faster performance.

tuiTools.name: helix
tuiTools.description: A post-modern modal text editor built in Rust with LSP, tree-sitter, and multiple cursors out of the box. The Kakoune-inspired vim alternative gaining serious traction.

trendingVideos.title: Stop Switching Between Cursor and JetBrains - AI Coding Native in IDEA
How I code with AI right now
Top 3 Most Critical AI Skills for 2026

highlights: Reverted VSCode multi-terminal support due to responsiveness issues—stability prioritized over features
Background agents continue to run while you work (introduced in 2.0.60)
Model attribution in Co-Authored-By commit messages for code provenance tracking
Session summaries with 1-line generated descriptions for context retention
Disallow floating promises code quality improvement from community contribution
Fixed shell execution service issues preventing truncation and bloat
GPT-5.1-Codex-Max default model—first model natively trained for multi-context 'compaction'
Critical security patch for CVE-2025-61260 command injection vulnerability (CVSS 9.8)
Linear integration—mention @Codex in issues to kick off cloud tasks

notableQuotes.quote: The vulnerability was assigned a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating critical severity. It allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands on developer machines without user interaction via malicious .env files.
notableQuotes.author: Check Point Research

notableQuotes.quote: Just two years ago, prompt engineering was hailed as a hot new job in tech. Now it has all but disappeared. Today, strong AI prompting is simply an expected skill, not a stand-alone role.
notableQuotes.author: Fast Company

notableQuotes.quote: An evaluation showed that the byLLM method achieved higher accuracy, better runtime performance, and greater robustness. Developers using byLLM completed tasks over three times faster and wrote 45% fewer lines of code.
notableQuotes.author: SPLASH Conference Researchers

prompt: Daily AI news digest generated by fetching from personal-homepage API feed, web searches for Claude Code/Gemini CLI/OpenAI Codex December 2025 news, trending GitHub repos via trotd (filtered for AI relevance), changelogs from all three tools, SkillsMP Claude skills feed, Docker MCP catalog searches, Claude Code hooks documentation/GitButler guide, TUI tools research, and YouTube trending videos API. Featured the Codex security vulnerability + GPT-5.1 release as hero (fresh angle not covered as hero in recent days), with emphasis on AI agent security concerns, academic AI accuracy issues, and practical hooks for workflow automation.
